content: A team of 10 divers carried out the survey, which began on September 20 and continued for 12 days. The department is planning one more phase of exploration when the sea conditions are favourable

title: Karnataka invites ETH Zurich‚Äôs quantum pioneer to next Quantum India Summit in Bengaluru
content: The State government has deepened its international scientific engagement with ETH Zurich ‚Äî one of the world‚Äôs leading institutions in quantum science and technology ‚Äî through a visit to the ETH Quantum Center and an invitation for its leadership to participate in the Quantum India Summit 2026 in Bengaluru.

title: Trinamool leaders follow Abhishek, donate for flood relief in North Bengal
content: The WB government has sought donations under West Bengal State Disaster Management Authority (WBSDMA) Fund for flood relief. Abhishek Banerjee donated ‚Çπ1 lakh for flood relief, calling upon everyone to rise to the occasion and help rebuild shattered lives.

title: Xi's purge: Bosses are disappearing in China - at alarming rate
content: Powerful figures in China are disappearing at an alarming rate. Top generals and CEOs are being detained or purged. This trend spans both the military and corporate elite. These crackdowns reflect a new phase in Xi Jinping's rule. Fear and obedience are being enforced across economic and military power centers. The scale of these purges is staggering.

title: 'Sudarshan' S-400: India, Russia discussing Rs 10K cr missiles deal; why it matters
content: India is set to acquire approximately Rs 10,000 crore worth of missiles for its S-400 air defence system, bolstering its capabilities after its reported success in Operation Sindoor. Discussions are underway with Russia to enhance long-range strike and interception, with the Defence Acquisition Council expected to review the proposal soon.

title: Bihar polls: Why Nitish, Tejashwi still call the shots; can Kishor break two-front curse?
content: Bihar's political landscape, dominated by RJD, JD(U), and BJP, sees smaller parties struggling to form a cohesive third front. Nitish Kumar's shifting alliances and Tejashwi Yadav's RJD face challenges, while Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj emerges as a potential disruptor, aiming to reshape the state's electoral dynamics beyond traditional power blocs.

title: AGI timeline: OpenAI cofounder disagrees with CEO Sam Altman; says AI agents are slop
content: OpenAI co-founder Andrej Karpathy criticized the current state of "agentic AI," calling it "slop" and not yet ready for widespread adoption. He believes AI agents require significant development and a decade of work, contrasting with optimistic timelines from figures like Sam Altman. Karpathy advocates for human-AI collaboration to enhance user capabilities rather than AI replacement.

title: Proxy war? Kabul sets record straight with Pak; rejects India's role in conflict
content: Afghanistan's defence minister Mullah Yaqoob denies India's role in recent clashes with Pakistan.  Pakistan had accused India of backing the Taliban. India, however, states Pakistan blames neighbors for its failures.  India has reopened its embassy in Kabul, strengthening ties with Afghanistan.  This move signifies a growing diplomatic and economic relationship between the two nations.

title: 'Gazab aadmi hai': Nitish's awkward garland moment goes viral; Tejashwi mocks CM
content: Tejashwi Yadav has questioned Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's fitness to lead, sharing a video of the CM struggling at a rally. Yadav also alleged Nitish's party might have deliberately incapacitated him. This renewed criticism comes as Assembly elections loom, with Yadav suggesting Nitish's behavior raises governance concerns.

title: 'Dated this obese woman': Decoding India hate in Young Republicans chat
content: ‚ÄãDuring the election, fewer Indian-Americans voted for Harris than they did for Democratic candidates like Biden, Clinton, or Obama. Even after the election, it appeared Indians were everywhere and integral to the Republican machine. Tulsi Gabbard, an honorary Indian, was now Director of National Intelligence. Sriram Krishnan was advising Trump on AI. Kash Patel was the FBI chief. But all of it appeared to be just veneer, and the contempt for the community continued unabated ‚Äî as evident during the MAGA Civil War, when the faithful attacked H-1B visa holders (mostly Indian-Americans) for Americans losing their jobs.

title: Who next for Tesla: Elon Musk poses big question; says, ‚ÄúIt won‚Äôt be me‚Äù
content: Elon Musk defended his massive pay package on X, questioning who else could lead Tesla given its market dominance. A Delaware judge previously ruled the 2018 deal flawed, but Tesla is appealing, arguing shareholders were fully informed. The outcome impacts Musk's commitment and Tesla's future leadership.

title: Kick streamer Sam Pepper banned for injuring 8-year-old with firecracker
content: British streamer Sam Pepper is facing backlash after a Diwali fireworks incident in New Delhi allegedly injured a young girl. While live-streaming, Pepper fired a firework towards a group, reportedly hitting a girl and causing a cut above her eyebrow. He has since admitted fault, covered medical costs, and been suspended from Kick.

title: Naqvi to India: 'Bring your captain and receive Asia Cup trophy from me'
content: The ACC chairman has proposed a Dubai ceremony on November 10 for India to receive the Asia Cup trophy, following the team's refusal to accept it from him after their win. This comes after a series of exchanges between the ACC and BCCI, with India having a perfect record against Pakistan in the tournament.

title: Economic warning: JPMorgan CEO urges action; Says US too dependent on unreliable sources
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is launching a $1.5 trillion, decade-long plan to bolster America's industrial strength and reduce foreign supply chain reliance.  The Security and Resiliency Initiative will target defense, frontier tech, energy, and advanced manufacturing, with the bank committing $10 billion to kickstart these vital sectors. Dimon urges immediate, unified action to secure the nation's future.

title: Bihar polls: Friendly fights or frayed ties? MGB's unity faces reality check
content: Bihar's Mahagathbandhan alliance is experiencing internal friction. Seat-sharing issues are causing confusion and overlapping nominations for the upcoming 2025 assembly elections. Smaller allies feel sidelined, with JMM withdrawing from the state-level arrangement. These coordination challenges could impact vote splits in key constituencies. Leaders are working to resolve disputes before polling begins.

title: Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh introduce daughter Dua to the world on Diwali
content: After months of keeping their daughter away from the public eye, Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh finally introduced their baby girl, Dua, to the world on the occasion of Diwali. The couple, who welcomed their first child in September 2024, had earlier requested paparazzi to respect their daughter‚Äôs privacy ‚Äî but this festive season, they decided to share a glimpse of their family joy.

title: Watch: 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi spotted bursting crackers on Diwali
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old cricket star, celebrated Diwali with fans after Bihar's Ranji Trophy victory. The young player, who also secured an IPL contract, is seen as a key figure in Bihar's cricket revival. Suryavanshi is expected to play in the upcoming ICC Under-19 World Cup. He is enjoying his moments off the field.

title: Riding high: Lokpal floats tender for 7 luxury BMWs; request sparks outrage online
content: India‚Äôs top anti-corruption body, the Lokpal, has come under fire after issuing a tender to purchase seven luxury BMWs, sparking allegations of hypocrisy and misuse of taxpayers‚Äô money. Opposition leaders, activists, and social media users criticised the move, highlighting the irony of an institution created to fight corruption indulging in lavish spending.

title: Bihar polls: Mahua to Raghopur ‚Äî top 5 high-profile seats to watch out for
content: Bihar's 2025 assembly elections are set for a high-stakes contest on November 6 and 11. Key constituencies like Raghopur and Mahua will witness intense battles, including family strongholds and 'friendly fights' between INDIA bloc partners, highlighting the RJD-Congress vs. BJP-JD(U) rivalry.

title: Chess: Historic! 10-year-old Indian-origin British chess prodigy beats ex-world champ
content: Ten-year-old British chess prodigy Bodhana Sivanandan achieved a historic victory, defeating former World Champion Grandmaster Mariya Muzychuk at the European Club Cup. This remarkable win, achieved while representing the She Plays to Win Lionesses, highlights Sivanandan's rapid ascent in the chess world. She continues to break records, solidifying her position as a rising star in English chess.

title: Oklahoma City Thunder vs Houston Rockets: Preview, lineup, prediction & where to watch
content: The 2025-26 NBA season kicks off October 21st with the reigning champion Oklahoma City Thunder hosting the Houston Rockets.  The Rockets, bolstered by two-time champion Kevin Durant, aim to impress.  Fans can catch the action on various networks and streaming platforms.  Expect a strong showing from both teams as they begin their championship quests.

title: Asia Cup row: Pak's Naqvi declines to hand over trophy again; BCCI to move ICC
content: India's Asia Cup victory remains marred by a trophy dispute, with ACC head Mohsin Naqvi refusing to release it to the BCCI. Despite requests from India, Afghanistan, and Sri Lanka, Naqvi insists on a BCCI representative collecting it from Dubai. The BCCI has rejected this, planning to raise the issue at an upcoming ICC meeting.

title: Lamar Jackson injury update: Ravens QB skips practice before must-win vs Bears
content: Lamar Jackson's hamstring injury continues to sideline the Baltimore Ravens quarterback, raising doubts about his availability for Sunday's crucial game against the Chicago Bears. Missing the past two games and Monday's practice, Jackson's return is vital for the 1-5 Ravens to salvage their disappointing 2025 season and playoff hopes.

title: Days before his death, Daniel Naroditsky posted video with shocking title
content: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky has died at age 29, with the cause undisclosed. Known for his talent as a player, commentator, and educator, Naroditsky's passing has prompted questions and discussions within the chess community. His family remembered him for his passion and the joy he brought to the game.

title: Bihar polls: AIMIM fields non-Muslim candidates; what is Owaisi's strategy?
content: AIMIM has released its first list of 25 candidates for the Bihar assembly elections, notably including two non-Muslim nominees. This move signifies Asaduddin Owaisi's strategy to broaden the party's appeal beyond its traditional Muslim base and position it as a social justice platform for all communities, aiming to contest beyond the Seemanchal region.

title: Govardhan Puja 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes for loved ones
content: Govardhan Puja 2025 is approaching, a festival celebrating Lord Krishna's protection of Vrindavan. Devotees prepare to share heartfelt wishes and messages. The article offers 70 wishes, messages, and quotes for family, friends, and colleagues. It also provides tips on celebrating this auspicious day, including worship of Govardhan Hill and offering Annakut. This festival emphasizes devotion, humility, and gratitude.

title: Mitch Marner drops confident comment after first goals, shakes up Golden Knights
content: Mitch Marner's two-goal outburst against the Calgary Flames has revitalized the Vegas Golden Knights, propelling them to the top of the Pacific Division.  His return to form, coupled with a perfect power play performance, signals a strong start to his debut season in Vegas, promising exciting times ahead for the team and its fans.

title: Is Iran going nuclear again? Satellite images show rebuilt Taleghan-2 - what is it?
content: New satellite imagery reveals Iran is rebuilding Taleghan 2, a former nuclear weapons development site at Parchin, following its destruction in an October 2024 Israeli air strike. Construction resumed in May 2025, with a new structure emerging by August. This rebuilding escalates tensions and renews debate over diplomatic efforts to curb Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: Stephen Curry reveals hilarious nickname for sister Sydel on her 31st birthday
content: Amidst personal speculations, Stephen and Ayesha Curry celebrated Sydel Curry Lee's 31st birthday. Stephen affectionately revealed his sister's nickname, 'Flossy,' in a heartwarming Instagram post. Sydel, an influencer, also shared a reflective message about her new life chapter, expressing gratitude for her community and family as she embraces turning 31.

title: Marcio Rubio faces backlash for 'Hindu-less' Diwali greeting
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio's Diwali message on X has drawn criticism for omitting any mention of Hindus, the festival's core community. Critics argue this dilutes Diwali's Hindu origins and feels dismissive, despite the message wishing joy and peace to all celebrants. The omission overlooks the festival's deep religious and cultural significance for Hindus worldwide.

title: Meet Sanae Takaichi, the 'iron lady' of Japan and first woman PM leading nation
content: Sanae Takaichi has become Japan's first female Prime Minister, elected leader of the LDP and approved by parliament. A prot√©g√© of Shinzo Abe, she inherits a complex landscape, focusing on economic stimulus, stronger defense, and assertive diplomacy, particularly concerning China and Taiwan. Her socially conservative and nationalist stance marks a historic milestone amid domestic and global pressures.

title: 'Defaming Diwali': BJP blames Punjab for Delhi's toxic air, says AAP made farmers burn stubble
content: Delhi Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa accused the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) of deliberately politicizing Diwali and Hinduism. He alleged that Arvind Kejriwal banned firecrackers to appease a specific community and that AAP leaders have been criticizing the festival. Sirsa emphasized that Diwali is a Sanatan Hindu festival, not a BJP one, questioning the AAP's negative stance.

title: After Daniel's death, Sarin blasts Kramnik - ‚ÄòBaseless accusations caused pain‚Äô
content: Indian Grandmaster Nihal Sarin has indirectly criticised Vladimir Kramnik following Daniel Naroditsky's death, citing relentless, baseless cheating accusations that caused immense pressure. Naroditsky, who called Kramnik "worse than dirt," experienced severe mental health impacts from the public harassment. The chess world mourns the loss of a bright light whose accessibility to millions was affected by these unfounded allegations.

title: 3 lakhs and counting! Anaya Bangar shares Diwali photo with father; pens heartfelt note
content: Anaya Bangar shared a heartwarming Diwali photo with her father, Sanjay Bangar, and family, sparking widespread attention.  Earlier this year, Anaya revealed her struggle to play cricket after her father's assertion of no place for her, leading to suicidal thoughts and a fight for her identity. She continues advocating for inclusivity in sports.

title: ‚ÄòBreak her legs‚Äô: Pragya Thakur tells parents to punish daughters for meeting ‚Äònon-Hindus‚Äô
content: Former Bhopal MP Pragya Singh Thakur has sparked controversy with remarks advising parents to physically punish daughters who visit non-Hindu homes, even suggesting "breaking their legs." Speaking at a religious event, Thakur urged parents to enforce obedience and values, stating that punishment is necessary for their well-being.

title: Items unverified for 40 yrs: Ivory, gold & valuables ‚Äòmissing‚Äô from Guruvayur temple; key findings
content: Audits reveal alarming lapses in Guruvayur Devaswom's management of temple valuables, including gold, silver, and ivory. Poor recordkeeping and missing documentation have left precious assets vulnerable to misuse. Despite legal requirements, physical verification of valuables has been neglected for decades, raising concerns about accountability and potential misappropriation.

title: Diwali bonus row causes chaos on Agra-Lucknow Expressway; toll gates flung open
content: Toll gates on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway were opened by protesting workers demanding a higher Diwali bonus, causing thousands of vehicles to pass without payment. Police intervened, leading to discussions where the company agreed to a 10% salary hike, restoring operations after a two-hour disruption.

title: Perth warning: Rohit, Kohli, and Iyer show cracks ahead of India‚Äôs 2027 ODI plans
content: India‚Äôs star batters -- Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Shreyas Iyer -- struggled in Perth, scoring just 19 runs between them against Australia in the first ODI in Perth. Limited match practice and absence from multiple formats exposed the technical flaws, raising concerns ahead of the 2027 ODI World Cup in South Africa.

title: Punjab shocker: Ex-DGP, wife booked over son‚Äôs suspicious death; video sparks probe
content: Former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa and his wife, ex-minister Razia Sultana, are among four booked by Haryana Police in connection with their son Akil Akhter's death. Akhter was found dead under suspicious circumstances, with social media posts alleging threats to his life. A Special Investigation Team has been formed to probe the matter.

title: LeBron James escapes lawsuit after fan claims he was ‚Äòduped‚Äô by fake retirement tease
content: A Los Angeles Lakers fan has withdrawn his lawsuit against LeBron James. The fan claimed he lost money after believing James' teaser video meant retirement. He bought expensive tickets for a game. The announcement was for a liquor advertisement. PrizePicks offered him free tickets and merchandise. This convinced him to drop the case.

title: 'Clear evidence attack was by Pakistan': ACB spokesperson on airstrike in Paktika
content: Afghanistan's cricket board has pulled out of a tri-series in Pakistan after accusing Islamabad of an airstrike that killed three Afghan cricketers.  The ACB spokesperson demanded global condemnation, citing evidence of Pakistani involvement.  National players reportedly support the withdrawal, with Zimbabwe replacing Afghanistan in the tournament.

title: Golden State Warriors unveil 2025‚Äì26 roster featuring Stephen Curry & Jimmy Butler
content: The Golden State Warriors have revealed their 2025-26 Opening Night roster, featuring Stephen Curry, Jimmy Butler, and Jonathan Kuminga. They will face the Los Angeles Lakers on October 21, who will be without LeBron James due to sciatica. This matchup marks Jimmy Butler's return after an ankle injury, and the Warriors aim to make a statement on opening night.

title: ‚ÄòKantara Chapter 1‚Äô box office collection day 20 (live): Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' outperforms Rishab Shetty starrer in Tuesday earnings
content: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' continues its impressive box office run, nearing Rs 550 crore. Despite strong performance, the film was outperformed on Tuesday by the new Diwali release, 'Thamma', which garnered over Rs 13 crore on its opening day.

title: Sarfaraz misses out; Pant recovers to be named captain of India A vs South Africa A - complete squads
content: Rishabh Pant will lead the India A squad in two four-day matches against South Africa A. This marks Pant's return after recovering from a toe injury sustained in England. He was previously named in the Delhi Ranji Trophy squad but may miss that fixture. The matches are scheduled for October 30 and November 6 in Bengaluru.

content: no. 1 draft pick has had quite the debut in the NHL, hasn't he? he started his NHL career with a five-game point streak (and counting) that's the second-longest point streak by any defenseman from the start of their career .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 8
content: a team with Would be in status is featured in this week's top 12 projection . teams listed as On the cusp are the true bubble teams and the first ones outside the bracket . one team with Work to do is passing the eye test and has a chance at winning its conference .

title: Graham ends retirement, agrees to rejoin Eagles
content: Brandon Graham has agreed to a one-year deal to suit up for his 16th season with the Eagles . he was the longest-tenured player in franchise history . his return comes on the heels of Za'Darius Smith's sudden retirement last week .

title: US visa chaos: New norms offer relief - who is exempt from paying $100k fee?
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More
